intro: Dysoxylum novohebridanum, commonly known as the New Hebrides dysoxylum, is a flowering plant native to the South Pacific islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, simple leaves, and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
